properties.address: Holy Trinity Church, Leytonstone, Greater London E11 4LD
properties.description: Space open to all people, offering free tea, coffee and snacks. There is an opportunity to shop for food essentials both fresh and non perishable from the community pantry. £3 buys £35+ worth of shopping. We serve free, nutritious and delicious breakfast and lunch from the Food Truck in partnership with The Skills Within. We can provide signposting and support to housing, health and wellbeing services. We are delighted to work with a digital artist to provide art courses for well being and a full Christmas dinner at Christmas from the local pub - the Leytonstone Tavern! The Food Share is a community where people are seen, heard and find space to belong. You are welcome here. Wheelchair access and toilet facilities, buggy access, creche facilities, baby changing, and all meals are vegan. All are welcome here, regardless of faith, sexuality, or gender orientation. This is a space where everyone is celebrated, respected, and valued for who they are. We believe in the inherent dignity and worth of every individual, and we strive to create a community where all feel safe, included, and empowered.
properties.title: Community Food Share

properties.address: 322, High Road, Ilford, Essex IG1 1QP
properties.description: Situated in the heart of Ilford for over 200 years, our church family comes from all over the world and we celebrate being a family that welcomes diverse cultures and languages. We have a wide range of facilities for children, parents and all age adults irrespective of religion, age or ethnicity. A daily offering of a welcoming atmosphere, with free hot drinks and biscuits! * Knitting Group – Mondays at 10.30am: make friends, drink tea and coffee as you knit. * Welcome Cafe and Toddlers – our Tuesday morning coffee morning. Free refreshments, board games and relaxing chat for adults and toys for pre-school and babies. * English Classes (Language Link) – supporting women and men to learn English. Women - Wednesdays & Thursdays 10am-12pm. Men - Thursdays & Fridays 10am-12pm. * AMPED children's Club each Friday from 6.45-8pm. Games, Sport and Quizzes on a Biblical theme for everybody. * Jeta e Re is a drop-in for Albanian speakers and friends. We have a children's programme and support for ESOL classes too. Saturdays 2-5pm.

We also have a cafe onsite run by Greenwich Pantry. You can use the space to work, study, meet, or simply to keep warm, for free. You can also find out about what else is going on in the local area including information about local support services. FREE | DROP-IN

properties.description: We offer a warm friendly space where you can pop along for a cuppa of your preferred hot drink and a biscuit or three. Whilst here you can take part in one of our weekly quizzes with the highly sort after prize of bragging rights for the week! all followed with a free light lunch of either Soup and a Roll or a Toasted Sandwich. We also have a bookshelf of books that you're welcome to take one home from or bring one to add to and offer a range of arts and crafts and well being sessions from time to time so come along and say hi.
properties.title: The Warm Hub

properties.address: Bonny Downs Community Association, London E6 6DQ
properties.description: Local residents can drop in to our warm community centre cafe anytime from 9am to 5pm on Mondays to Fridays to enjoy FREE tea and WiFi, optional books and board games – and of course a friendly chat. Everyone is welcome and it’s all completely free, so no one is left out this winter.

properties.title: Upminster Library

properties.address: The Renewal Programme, London E12 6PG
properties.description: The Renewal Programme have launched their Stay Warm in Newham project and have opened their first warm bank on Tuesday 24th January 2023. Newham residents are encouraged to attend our warm bank sessions to access energy- related advice/services and activities, to help reduce energy cost. We also provide a welcoming space for residents to enjoy tea and coffee with some company. Our warm bank runs three days a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at The Renewal Programme. You will have the opportunity to engage with our energy experts, Groundwork’s Green Doctors, who will be there every Tuesday to offer advice to residents on how to reduce energy cost while keeping their home warm. They also provide in-depth referrals via telephone calls or home visits (subject to eligibility). We are also providing hot meals every Wednesdays from 12:00pm- 1:00pm. We have a wide range of halal and vegetarian options. Everyone is welcome from Newham!
properties.title: Warm Bank

properties.address: Greenwich Leisure Ltd, London SE18 6DL
properties.description: In a prime riverside location Waterfront Leisure Centre is a fantastic multi-use community sport and leisure facility located in the heart of Woolwich, SE18. It boasts a modern newly refurbished 150 plus station gym with the latest Technogym cardiovascular, strength and resistance machines. A new functional fitness area is the perfect place for a HIIT work out and two further studios host a wide variety of Fitness Classes for all ages and abilities. This includes a multi purpose black out studio for interactive group cycle and yoga classes. The centre has a 25m fitness pool and a leisure pool with slides and a wave machine, sauna and Jacuzzi making it the perfect place for all your water activities including our Better Swim School lessons, aqua aerobics, fitness swims and family sessions. Facilities available for hire include a multi-use sports hall, indoor 5-a-side pitch and squash courts. Waterfront Leisure Centre is conveniently located, only a short walk from Woolwich DLR Station and the new Elizabeth Line Tube Station. There are excellent road, bus and train links from Greenwich, Charlton, Blackheath, Plumstead, Belvedere and Erith and Kent. We look forward to welcoming you very soon.
properties.title: Waterfront Leisure Centre

properties.description: Organisation running the Warm Centre: MDC Primary Care Network First line of address of Warm Centre venue: St Patrick Church hall Town: Chislehurst County: Kent Postcode - please enter full postcode: BR7 6DB Contact email for public enquiries: Phone number for public enquiries: Enter your website: www.mdcpcn.nhs.uk Enter details of any social media accounts if you would like to engage with us and others online: https://www.facebook.com/mdcPCN Please provide details of your open times. e.g Mondays 10-2pm and Fridays 1pm- 3pm: Every other Friday 10.30am-12.30pm from Firday January 10th 2025 Do you provide teas/coffees?: yes Are the teas/coffees free of charge?: yes Please provide a short summary of what you offer and at what times/days. This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: We offer a warm, welcoming place to relax and get information from various NHS health professionals, games - bingo and light chair exercise. We offer warm and cold drinks, cakes and fruit for the duration of the cafe. This cafe is free of charge and for over 75s; carers are very welcome to stay. We will not turn anyone away. Please come and join us Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Open throughout the year with dates scheduled to 19/12/2025. (No cafes will run on bank holidays) Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know:

properties.description: Organisation running the Warm Centre: River Church - Orpington First line of address of Warm Centre venue: Giggs Hill Church Town: Orpington County: Kent Postcode - please enter full postcode: BR5 2SA Contact email for public enquiries: alice.cross@river-church.co.uk Phone number for public enquiries: 07926 934096 Enter your website: www.river-church.co.uk Enter details of any social media accounts if you would like to engage with us and others online: Facebook - @RiverChurchOrpington Instagram - @orpingtonriverchurch Please provide details of your open times. e.g Mondays 10-2pm and Fridays 1pm- 3pm: Mondays 10am-12noon, Wednesdays 10.30am-12, Thursdays 7-9pm Do you provide teas/coffees?: yes Are the teas/coffees free of charge?: yes Please provide a short summary of what you offer and at what times/days. This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: Mondays - A coffee drop in with hot drinks and cake/snacks. Anyone is welcome from babies to elderly. There are childrens toys and activities and games and activities for adults too if they wish. Wednesday is Rover Tots (Parent/Carers and their 0-preschool age children) activities, crafts, story and songs. Drinks and snacks provided. Thursdays are adult only social evenings, drinks and food, games and activities. Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Run throughout the year - term time only Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know:
